The selection of these indices is based on (i) published results and expert judgement of the high sensitivity of theses indices to capture changes in food webs, (ii) sensitive to specific pressures, (iii) analysing the structure, diversity and functioning of ecosystems, which is an important quest emerging from European Directives and (iv) the potential of theses indices to be easily communicated to stakeholders.

u_shaped_ranking.context_window: SDG Indicator List 14.2 By 2020, sustainably manage and protect marine and coastal ecosystems to avoid significant adverse impacts, including by strengthening their resilience, and take action for their restoration in

sentences.content: Key Message
The Ecological Network Analysis indices support the assessment of the structure and functioning of f...
webs by analysing interactions between all ecosystem components for four case studies.
Different trends of
indices were found over time and space, some linked to variability in primary production.
Conclusion
This pilot assessment illustrates the potential for the ENA indices indicator to show changes in the...
food webs at regional (COMP4 assessment areas) scale and provides key information on the temporal
variability of food web structure and functioning. This pilot assessment demonstrates inter-annual
variability within study sites and variability between them.
Conclusion (extended)
This pilot assessment illustrates the potential for the ENA indices indicator to show changes in the...
structure and functioning at regional (COMP4 assessment areas) scale and provides information on the...
of the food webs.
The pilot assessments indicate that ENA indices are influenced by the availability of primary produc...
References
Baird, D. and R. E. Ulanowicz (1993).
Comparative study on the trophic structure, cycling and ecosystem
properties of four tidal estuaries. Marine Ecology Progress Series 99:221–237.
Baird, D., H. Asmus and R. Asmus (2012).
